title: 112_hr3864
content: The Act titled "American Energy and Infrastructure Jobs Financing Act of 2012" extends the expenditure authority of the trust fund. The Highway Trust Fund, Sport Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund, and Leaking Underground Storage Tank Trust Fund are all amended by the American Energy and Infrastructure Jobs Act of 2012, changing dates and references within the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Leaking Underground Storage Tank Trust Fund amendment changes the effective date from April 1, 2012, to October 1, 2016. SEC. 3. EXTENSION OF HIGHWAY-RELATED TAXES. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change various dates to later ones, such as from March 31, 2012 to September 30, 2018, and from April 1, 2012 to October 1, 2018. Additionally, the tax on the use of certain heavy vehicles is extended from 2012 to 2018. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates to later ones, such as from March 31, 2012 to September 30, 2018, and from April 1, 2012 to October 1, 2018. Additionally, certain exemptions and tax transfers are extended to 2018 and 2019. Certain exemptions and tax transfers are extended to 2018 and 2019. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to change dates to later ones, such as from March 31, 2012 to September 30, 2018, and from April 1, 2012 to October 1, 2018. Certain exemptions and tax transfers are extended to 2018 and 2019, including motorboat and small-engine fuel tax transfers. The effective date for the amendments made by this section is April 1, 2012, except for subsection (b)(2) which applies to periods beginning after September 30, 2012. SEC. 4 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 appropriates revenues from certain domestic energy leases to the Highway Trust Fund. This includes revenues from onshore and offshore domestic energy leasing and production generated by specific acts. The effective date for this amendment is after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 5 establishes an Alternative Transportation Account. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 appropriates $40 billion to the Alternative Transportation Account from Treasury funds. Any amount appropriated shall remain available without fiscal year limitation. Amounts transferred to the Mass Transit Account in the Highway Trust Fund for fiscal year 2012 are now transferred to the Highway Account. The Mass Transit Account in the Highway Trust Fund is renamed to the Alternative Transportation Account. The text and heading of subsection (e) of section 9503 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended accordingly.
